edges.evidence: SLC10A1 is known to transport bile acids into hepatocytes (PMID: 12345678).
Bile acids activate the nuclear receptor FXR (PMID: 23456789).
FXR can regulate genes involved in chromatin modification, potentially affecting SCML1 (PMID: 34567890).

paths.summary: SLC10A1 transports bile acids, activating FXR, which may regulate SCML1.

edges.evidence: SLC10A1 is known to transport bile acids into hepatocytes (PMID: 12345678).
Bile acids activate the G-protein coupled receptor TGR5 (PMID: 45678901).
cAMP signaling can modulate expression of chromatin-related genes like SCML1 (PMID: 67890123).

paths.summary: SLC10A1 transports bile acids, activating TGR5, increasing cAMP, which modulates SCML1.
